content: Hello, how can I assist you today?
How to clone a repository into this folder I am currently in?

To clone a repository into the current folder, you can use the `git` command within a code cell in your Jupyter Notebook. Here's how you can do it:

```python
!git clone <repository_url> .
```

Replace `<repository_url>` with the actual URL of the repository you want to clone.

Here is how it would look within the context of your notebook:

```python
# Individual Recommender Systems - Tutorial 1 (Lab 1)

# Clone the repository into the current folder
!git clone <repository_url> .

# Continue with your imports and other code
preprocessed_dataset_folder = "../preprocessed_dataset"
import pandas as pd
```
How can I load data from a folder that is two folders up from this folder?

To load data from a folder that is two levels up from your current folder, you can use relative paths. In a Jupyter Notebook, relative paths are typically used with the `..` syntax. Here is the modified version of your function:

```python
import pandas as pd

def read():
    ## assumes dataset is two folders up
    wines_path = "../../Documents/Documents - MacBook Air von Sebastian/Maastricht University/Year 3/Recommender Systems/Project repository/Datasets/All-XWines_Full_100K_wines_21M_ratings/XWines_Full_100K_wines.csv"
    wines = pd.read_csv(wines_path, low_memory=False, encoding="utf-8", memory_map=True)
    
    # Add this line if you also have ratings data
    ratings_path = "<path_to_your_ratings_file>"
    ratings = pd.read_csv(ratings_path, low_memory=False, encoding="utf-8", memory_map=True)
    
    return wines, ratings
```

Replace `<path_to_your_ratings_file>` with the correct relative path for your ratings data if needed.

A relative path specifies a location relative to the current working directory. For accessing a dataset located two folders up, you would use `../../` to navigate up two directories.

Hereâ€™s your updated code:

```python
def read():
    # Assumes the dataset is two folders up
    wines = pd.read_csv("../../Documents/Documents - MacBook Air von Sebastian/Maastricht University/Year 3/Recommender Systems/Project repository/Datasets/All-XWines_Full_100K_wines_21M_ratings/XWines_Full_100K_wines.csv", low_memory=False, encoding="utf-8", memory_map=True)
    
    # Provide the correct path for ratings or update as necessary
    ratings_path = "../../Documents/.../ratings.csv"  # Adjust the path accordingly
    ratings = pd.read_csv(ratings_path, low_memory=False, encoding="utf-8", memory_map=True)
    
    return wines, ratings
```
